page.title: 04Life styles
page.content: This is a very rural area with virtually no amenities. The nearest town is Wareham, six miles away, and as there is only one bus per week from Bere Regis to Wareham for residents to visit the Purbeck District Council Offices, Employment Exchange, shops, banks, etc., it is essential to have the use of a car. There is a little employment locally, on farms, at the sawmills, Golf Club, small industries and fruit farm; otherwise residents travel to Poole, Blandford, Wareham, Dorchester, Bovington Camp and Winfrith Atomic Energy Station for employment, and also for shopping. Children may attend playschool at Bere Regis at the age of three years, and formal education begins at five years when they attend Bere Regis County First School until the age of nine.
